utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So, it's hard to jump to an assumption, there is no obstruction of justice until the investigation is over.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, no, it isn't. It isn't actually and you're talking to a prosecutor so I think I have this covered. Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You would agree that the investigation --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. Educate me about the law. What I'm telling you is, is that Comey testified and said that he did not feel that the President of the United States was trying to obstruct any kind of investigation or justice. So, what happened? The guy was just five minutes ago basically let go and fire. So did something else materialize in between that time that is going to be a game changer and tell you that their actual facts to substantiate these? Where is it going to come from?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. So, let's be very clear here. It was the Trump Justice Department that appointed a special counsel in this investigation. Therefore, his own Justice Department thinks there is a there there and that's why --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That is not true.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Why else would you have a special counsel?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I found it --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They don't point on Juan, oh, we think for sure, somebody, they are saying, look, if there is been something, something that, some kind of suspicion or suggestion, and the interest of justice and the interest of transparency, we will go ahead and put this forward. That is very different from saying, well, no, if there is flat out evidence than we do, like Jim -- in a grand jury --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. We'll let Greg in for -- last word.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's my point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm saying, you will not going to find anything that Trump hasn't already said. He's the most transparent president in the history of the United States. You know his every thought. You know what he's doing. You know where he's at because he's tweeting it. There is no cover-up because he refuses to keep his mouth shut.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know everything that's going on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's just amazing, Jesse. Give me one more second here with Jesse because the President said during the campaign that the election was rigged against them. But basically, what "The Washington Post" story today is saying is that, election might have tried to be rigged, but in his favor, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, I can't even keep up with how much rigging is going on. What I do know is this. President Obama knew that the Russians were trying to do something with the election did not. Hillary Clinton had a secret server, was potentially hacked nor it did anything to her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The DNC was warned about hacking. They didn't put up any defenses. And then they got hacked and they didn't do anything about that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And wouldn't turn on its server.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. And then Podesta gave his password to a hacker and the password was password. So, how is this Trump's fault again?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I can't figure out why you're talking about. He's the president. Can we move on? You guys continued to obsess about Hillary Clinton like how I started the segment.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's a perfect Segway guys, we're going to move on. Coming up, actor Johnny Depp is apologizing for joking about assassinating President Trump. But is he sincere? That story when we return.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, he's not!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right now somewhere under a rock, Kathy Griffin is smiling.

utterances.speaker: JOHNNY DEPP, ACTOR
utterances.utterance: When was the last time an actor assassinated a president? I want to clarify. I'm not an actor. I lie for a living. However, it's been a while and maybe it's time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, he's drunk. Anyway, that moment, sums up Depp's declining career. In a desperate attempt to be edgy, he figured he can win over the British audience with the joke about killing Trump, when all else fails, go there. It reveals a truth about Depp. He was never a trailblazer, but an imitator. That is why he still impersonates Keith Richards wherever he goes. Remember how Rachel Dolezal decided to as black, Depp is doing the same thing. He is culturally appropriating Keith Richards. And now Depp is 54. A member of AARP, it's time to stop dressing like your mother's hat rack. Now he since apologizing saying, he intended no malice and he probably didn't. What he intended to do was maintain his relevance. Clean to a coolness. That is dwindling. And easiest way to say stop the Hollywood thinks it's dangerous when it's really not. Now, the real dangerous comment is saying that you like Trump. But the bloated parrot that is Depp reveals that all celebrities do is copy other celebrities. Act like Keith Richards, talk like Kathy Griffin, drink like Oliver Reid. Who is Johnny Depp, I don't even thing he knows. So, it's not the joke that is the real outrage. It's the banality of it. So how desperate must you be to say, you want to kill the President just for applause. Johnny Depp desperate. He wants so badly to be a rolling stone, but he's just rolling stoned. Jesse, he apologized, they always do. They always do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. It kind of like, it was like, oh, yes. It went over your head. You guys didn't get it. It wasn't a real apology. I think Pirate Johnny said too much wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I think what's going on right now, I'm actually ran out of things to say about celebrities talking about assassinating the president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's gotten kind of old. There is a pattern now that's emerging. The hard core Hollywood left has an assassination fetish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There is a death cult surrounding the President. Now, could you imagine if, let's just say, Vince Vaughn or, you know, Greg Gutfeld, a cabal of entertainment right wing celebrities started fantasizing about assassinating President Obama. It would be earth shattering.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I think his name is Ted Nugent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Won. Okay. Not like 16, like we do this every night on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I just want someone in Hollywood to at least condemn this guy. Can they condemn him? I mean --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'll do it. I'll do it. I'll condemn him. I'll condemn him and I'll condemn Ted Nugent and I'll condemn all of this people who are trying resurrect their careers, by trying to get into the news cycle by attacking the President. Where there be Barack Obama or Donald Trump or George Bush for that matter. They are all bad, condemned.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, I would actually take this seriously --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And so, because, and so should the Secret Service.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Forgets the law, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, yes. This is a problem actually. If you think that the Secret Service doesn't let this guy anywhere near the President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He wasn't joking at the end. Did you notice that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He is not kidding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He wasn't kidding.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And also, he has actually troubling past of addiction with alcohol --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Violence.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Domestic violence, restraining orders just in May by his ex-wife, she filed a restraining order against him, was documented by an eyewitness. One of her friends Rachel Pennington (ph) was there. He threw a phone, hit her in the face, had a big magnum of wine, was swinging and trying to hit her. He's really got a lot of problems. He's getting close to broke. He is in a huge lawsuit with his business managers and the people that -- you know, handling his money. So, the whole thing is a big disaster. So, this is somebody who is coming a little bit unhinged. They take these things seriously and I think they should. Who knows? But you know, nevertheless hopefully he's learned his lesson and, you know, sobered up a little bit about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I like your point that it was sobered. That it gets to be so routine that it's like it fails to shock.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because that's what they're trying to do. So, Kathy Griffin if you remember when she held up a severed head of President Trump in the video that post, she talks to the cameraman and she says, you know we are going to get in a lot of trouble for this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And so, she intended to get all of this attention. And even though, I guess we can't say for sure because we don't have videotape of Johnny Depp doing the same thing. I imagine that he knew he won't really pay that big a price because in Hollywood, you really won't be condemned.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm. Yes. It's true. But that last line he said maybe it's time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, it was a joke in the frontend and then he said, I'm not an actor, I'm a liar. And then at the end, he comes back and he goes, well, maybe it's time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's inciting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes. It was a joke up -- it was a party up front but serious in the back to reverse of a --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Mullet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mullet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You two are like on the same wavelength.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is scary.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What is that tell you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Up next, Ainsley Earhardt, exclusive, yes, it's an interview with President Trump. He had a lot to say about former FBI Director James Comey. More when we come back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: President Trump made this week the frenzy speculation when he suggests that he might have tapes with his conversations with ousted FBI Director James Comey. Well, yesterday, President Trump confirmed that he had, no tapes, and discussed the issue with Ainsley Earhardt.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I didn't tape him. You never know what's happening when you see that the Obama administration and perhaps longer than that was doing all of this unmasking and surveillance. I don't have any tape and I didn't tape. But when he found out that, you know, that there may be tapes out there, whether it's governmental tapes or anything else and who knows, I think his story may have changed. My story didn't change. My story was always the straight story. My story was always the truth. But you will have to determine for yourself whether or not his story changed. But I did nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Greg, so yes --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's okay.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, he said that he's talking about his -- he doesn't have any tapes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love it, I love it, I love it, I love it. He never said there were tapes. He just said, I hope, for Comey's sake, he wasn't recorded, which was brilliant. Because what he did was he ran circles around the media and the media spent how many weeks just -- and many said like, you're going to be very disappointed, believe me. It's just like, this is what he does. When are people going to figure out, this is what he does and he's really good at it and I love that he's giving her a tour of the White House.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I already said that I didn't think it was brilliant. But I also think it's not a revelation that Mueller and Comey knew each other because they've actually, it's a small group of people that actually work at that level of the FBI and the Justice Department and they all sort of know each other. I don't know if Mueller actually asked for FEC data of the people that he was hiring. That might be a good question to ask him if he didn't or if he did like why or why not. If there's truly nothing there, who better than to have announced that Clinton affiliated folks? Because that will actually solidify it. So, President Trump is actually set himself up, so either way. If it comes back that there was nothing there, the Clinton people say it. Done deal. If it comes back that there might have been something there, was when the satellite that he talked about a couple of weeks ago, then it's biased because they're Clinton affiliated people. That's how I see it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She summed it up. There you go. Jesse, I don't know if you can top that, I am going to give you a chance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: As much as it pains me to say, I agree with Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why do you always do that? I am wondering about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: First you rip on her dog yesterday.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. It's like every week, it makes them feel better -- it pains him to agree with me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. I think you are exactly right. I think you are exactly right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're getting better.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Actually, I'd like to advance the story too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think what Trump is doing is he's playing into the rigged system. Remember what he did during the election, with the FBI investigation was rigged, the fake polls were rigged, the media is out to get me. You know, it's all rigged, rigged, rigged. So, when he sets this Mueller investigation up, it's potentially biased, that plays into Trump's army against the establishment. On the Comey tapes, that was a bluff obviously. Some people think, it backfired, because the now special counsel, other people think it made Comey have to say things that he wouldn't have otherwise said, it made him more honest. But Trump has the history of doing this. When he tweeted about Obama spied on him, that led to the unmasking scandal. When he tweeted that, you know, about Mueller, he's kind of like working the refs. And then, you know, he says something about --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Working the reps.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: ... Pelosi. You know, Pelosi, we love Pelosi. Wanted to stay there forever. He's great for Republican Party. That's like reverse psychology for the Democrats. And now the Democrats are scratching their heads like, oh, Trump likes Pelosi too, like, maybe we should get rid of her. So that's what he does, and it works.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, how is it broken out?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: If it launches an investigation against you that has mired down you White House...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Three for four.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute. Which mires down your White House as entire agenda, then I don't think it's working. But I actually not painfully agree with Dana on this point.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: And I think the other point...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Gleefully.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Gleefully agree with Dana on this point. And the other point that I want to make is I think Republicans need to be very careful...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: ... about this argument that, oh, all the Mueller people gave money to Hillary Clinton, all the Mueller people gave money to Democrats (inaudible) Democrats. Trump and Jared Kushner, they hosted a fundraiser for Cory Booker in their condo down the street from here. So are they out to get the president too?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was when they were business people.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: That was last year.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was when they were...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They were also (inaudible) the election.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: That's my point. The point is...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everybody is friend.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: ... everybody gives money.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Everybody is friend.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I would give Dana money because Dana is my friend.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And Dana would (inaudible) that donation because you are filled with scandals, Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Not much as scandal as you.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO
utterances.utterance: ... running for office is Kimberly Guilfoyle.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I would give to Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: There we go, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Democrats would accuse me of giving to Republicans. So this is a silly argument. And not to mention, I guarantee if you look at FCC filings, you will find out that sometime in Donald Trump's history, he gave money to Democrats. Remember, the Clinton (inaudible) wedding.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's documented. He gave money to everybody.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So let's quit this argument because it makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Again, going back to Trump being the most transparent person on the planet. He talked about, they were at my wedding, you know, what do you expect? I need them there. It's like I do business. This is what I do. He's a real estate developer. I got to get these people over here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He sprinkles a little sugar here and there.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: (inaudible) sprinkle sugar, that's all I'm saying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think we need a weekend.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Thank God it's Friday.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe we need to go (inaudible), right? Facebook Friday anyway.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's wrong with everybody? This show is going great.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: It is going great.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know, fine, never mind. An unbelievable story up next. A Democratic official is caught on tape saying he's glad that Steve Scalise was shot. We are going to play it for you next. You won't believe it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: More vicious rhetoric from the left. As we reported last week, there were a course of calls to tone down the heat on political rhetoric after a liberal activist went on a shooting spree on a group of Republicans wounding five including House Majority Whip Steve Scalise. Mr. Scalise is thankfully now out of the ICU and is listed in fair condition. But, Phil Montag who was recently ousted as chair of the Nebraska Democratic Party's Technology Committee had a different reaction to the shooting.

utterances.speaker: PHIL MONTAG, OUSTED CHAIR OF NEBRASKA DEMOCRATIC PARTY TECHNOLOGY COMMITTEE
utterances.utterance: (beep) his whole job is like to kick people, convince Republicans (beep) people off of health care. I'm glad he got shot. I'm glad he got shot.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's one of the most outrageous things we've heard on "The Five" recently and we've heard a lot of outrageous things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nebraskan are probably reeling from this. It's interesting, as you listen to that, the colleagues are saying, how can you say that? I think it's right that he lost his job. He wasn't the only one. Just this week, Tucker Carlson had Jim DeVine on. He was the one that had the hashtag on Republicans. I do wonder about the Democrats having any sort of like a pause to realize some of the things that have been said. Greg mentioned one yesterday. About Elizabeth Warren saying that the Republicans want blood money for the health care bill. A lot of this is just so apocalyptic at the top. And now we actually talk about somebody who did get shot and thankfully his condition is improving. It's so traumatic. It was only a week ago.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's awful.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's seems like much longer than that because of the news cycles, the way that they are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's incredible. Maybe he was just doing his best Johnny Depp.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How many leftist have said this in private? And they were lucky they weren't taped.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He said what he really felt. He said what he felt. A lot of people don't. Here's the issue with the Democrats. They can get out of this. This grumpy demonization, what you're talking about, is because they've kind of like neglected the young people in their party. It's party of children. It's a bunch of emotional, tantrum oriented people. The Democratic Party has to start telling its people to grow up. You're not a kid anymore. You have to start thinking instead of feeling. Right now, they are just a bunch of babies sitting on splinters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, Greg makes a point, and he says maybe more Democrats in the privacy of their own homes feel and think this way. Do you think that is a prevalent feeling within some of these Democratic activists?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They enjoy the violence?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I took the real road.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: That's the low road.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I never take a low road. I'm always on the right road.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right fact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly was saying...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Kimberly. Kimberly is going to take the high road.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You are on the high road.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Never mind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead, Kimberly. You want to do make a point about Greg's observation.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I was just going to say that I believe that people are inherently good and that the people that I know that are Democrats would never want this to happen to anyone, Democrat or Republican, I think, those sides are equally appalled by what he had to say. He shouldn't have been fired for it. Really got awful. He should think about it was somebody that he's related to or his family remember. He's not somebody who has the best interest of the people in his heart to serve when he behaved in that way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did you see those activists and those students at Evergreen College? Bunch of fascist. They would love this. You are breeding in the Democratic Party a group of people who reject debate and therefore think about violence because they take the stock out between emotion and violence. They remove it that's why (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because there is no legislative victories, they are not fighting the real fight and not winning the debate of ideas, they are resorting to violence?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: First of all, this is a low level -- he's not even a staffer. He doesn't get...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He was a member of Hillary Clinton presidential campaign.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, he wasn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he was.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Where did you get that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he was. Part of Hillary Clinton's Nebraska campaign team.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Yeah, the campaign team as Dana can tell you, everybody says they're part of the campaign team, the volunteer who stamped (ph) the envelopes, who packs (inaudible) bags say they're part of the campaign team.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute, this is part of the problem that we have in this country. When people say we need to take a chill pill and sort of realized-- we agree or disagree with -- this is part of it. He is (inaudible) just as much as the people who say that Hillary Clinton should be shot for treason. Remember the New Hampshire House said who was a Republican (inaudible) White House this week. This is -- we have to take a chill pill altogether. We can disagree on policy, we can disagree on how things get done, but we are all humans and we are all Americans. What you do, oh, he was part of Clinton campaign team, is you create more hostility between the two parties. That's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If the Republicans take one chill pill, the Democrats need to take three. Ahead, (inaudible) interview with Dennis Rodman just back from North Korea after playing (inaudible) again with ruthless tyrant Kim Jong-un. Prepare yourself. Up next.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Dennis Rodman will do anything for publicity. That is why he just went back to North Korea to visit his pal, Kim Jong-un. He arrived the same day as Otto Warmbier was released. Rodman's agent say the timing wasn't a coincidence.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Do you think being there had anything to do with that?

utterances.speaker: CHRIS VOLO, DENNIS RODMAN'S AGENT
utterances.utterance: I know being there had something to do with it because when I was organizing the trip, I meet with the delegates here, you know, I addressed, you know, Otto Warmbier.

utterances.speaker: DENNIS RODMAN, RETIRED BASKETBALL PLAYER
